means: （距离，长度）长的( long的最高级 )
（因忙或不愉快等）似乎比实际时间长的

sentence.Network_en: She studied him for the longest time, looking wryly amused.
sentence.Network_cn: 她面带苦笑，盯着他看了很长时间。

sentence.Network_en: He produced "A Chorus Line", Broadway's longest running show.
sentence.Network_cn: 他制作推出了《歌舞线上》这一百老汇经久不衰的剧目。

sentence.Network_en: Bradley will go down in history as Los Angeles' longest serving mayor.
sentence.Network_cn: 布拉德利将作为洛杉矶任期最长的市长被载入史册。

the author successfully simulated the rapid sliding of avalanche soils on mild slope with saturated soils in flume experiments , and the longest distance that avalanche masses can move was studied .通过水槽实验，对崩塌土所能到达的最远距离进行了研究，成功地模拟了崩塌块体在饱和度较高的缓坡上快速滑行的现象。
大学英语四级常用词组 ... as long as 达…之外，长达 at longest (把日期)至多，最晚 before long 不久以后.
1. 我们在这里至多只能呆三天at longest（指日期）至多，最晚，最长：. 。
the yellow river is the longest river next to the changjiang river in china ., 黄河是中国仅次于长江的最长的河流.
The Darling River is the third longest river in Australia ., 达令河是澳大利亚第三长的河流.

means.word_mean: 1. having the greater length of two or the greatest length of several;

Sentence.sentence: The essay is the hardest thing to do, so he's put it off the longest.
Those schools usually require essays of their own, but the longest essay, 500 words maximum, is generally attached to the Common Application
